newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Metrovacesa Q1 pretax up 21.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Metrovacesa Q1 pretax up 21.8 pct.

text.p: Spanish property firm Metrovacesa said on Monday its first quarter pre-tax profit rose 21.8 percent to 2.52 billion pesetas.
The statement added that rental income from January to March this year rose four percent to 1.94 billion pesetas.
First quarter net profit rose a mere four percent to 1.66 billion pesetas, the note added.

It also explained the lower trend of growth in the net profit compared with pre-tax value was due to heavier fiscal pressure, as tax rose 81.1 percent to 864 million pesetas in the first quarter of 1997.
Metrovacesa said it expected rental income would increase more than four percent in the following months, because the company is renting 126 additional flats in the Torres de Madrid.
Metrovacesa added also that in the first quarter cash flow rose 13 percent to 2.21 billion pesetas.
